channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Confessions of a 1980s flight attendant
item.description: Ann Hood, a best-selling author, has recounted her adventures working as cabin crew on TWA flights in the 1980s in a book detailing the highs and lows of life during the early jet age.

item.title: US military targets Houthi radar sites in Yemen after a merchant sailor goes missing
item.description: The United States military has unleashed a wave of attacks targeting radar sites operated by Yemen’s Houthi rebels over their assaults on shipping in the crucial Red Sea corridor

item.title: DeSantis quietly signs controversial condo bill. Owners are already threatening to sue
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: On its 12th anniversary, DACA is on the ropes as election looms
item.description: Dreamers who advocated for the implementation of DACA in 2012 continue to fight for the program, whose future remains uncertain.

item.title: June 13, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The US-backed Gaza ceasefire proposal doesn't meet Hamas' demands for an end to the war, a senior official has told CNN. Osama Hamdan also said that "no one has an idea" how many of the hostages held in the enclave are alive.

item.title: Firefighter killed in explosion while battling fire in Southern California
item.description: A Los Angeles County firefighter has been killed after responding to a vehicle fire at a quarry in a desert community north of Los Angeles

item.title: B-52 Future Stratofortress: The Upgrades That Will Transform The B-52H Into The B-52J
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: 6/14: CBS Evening News
item.description: Princess Kate says she is making "good progress" in cancer fight; Baltimore educator to be honored at Tony Awards

item.title: Biden and Zelensky lay out new US support for Ukraine
item.description: US President Joe Biden and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky signed a new security agreement Thursday as world leaders gathered for the G7 summit in Italy.

item.title: Alex Jones’ personal assets to be sold to pay $1.5B Sandy Hook debt. Company bankruptcy is dismissed
item.description: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones is facing a court-ordered sell-off of many of his personal assets while the future of his Infowars media platform remains up in the air

item.title: Aides' vehicle in a convoy carrying Mexico's next president involved in a crash that killed 1
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Tensions between Israel and Hezbollah stir U.S. fears of wider conflict
item.description: Since Oct. 7, the Biden administration has been furiously working behind the scenes to lower the chances of a conflagration that could draw in the U.S. or put at further risk U.S. troops who are in the region in Syria, Iraq and Jordan.

item.title: Supreme Court maintains access to abortion pill in unanimous decision
item.description: The Supreme Court has issued a decision on whether the US Food and Drug Administration overstepped its authority by expanding access to the abortion pill mifepristone.

item.title: Maine opens contest to design a new state flag based on an old classic
item.description: Mainers are going to decide in November whether to adopt a new flag, but the state needs to settle on a design first

item.title: Elon Musk’s prediction that Chinese carmakers would ‘demolish’ global rivals is coming true as they overtake U.S. competitors
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Texas woman moves into new home on land which was taken from her family by racist mob in 1939
item.description: Opal Lee was just 12 years old when a racist mob burned down her family's home in Fort Worth, Texas. Eight decades later, with the help of donors and nonprofit groups, she was gifted the property, and a new home was built on it for free. Steve Hartman has more in "On the Road."

item.title: Trump in Washington for meetings with Republican allies
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is back in Washington for the first time since becoming the presumptive Republican nominee as well as a convicted felon. Follow here for the latest live news updates.

item.title: DOJ declines to prosecute Garland after House Republicans pass contempt resolution
item.description: Garland had refused to turn over audio of Biden's special counsel interview.

item.title: Man arrested and charged on 17 counts, facing $1 million bond
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Trump celebrates 78th birthday as Rubio makes surprise appearance
item.description: It was Sen. Marco Rubio's first time appearing on the 2024 campaign trail alongside former President Donald Trump.
